UseParquet module¶

UseParquet.exportQueryResults(parquetFilePath, outFilePath, outFileType: FileTypeEnum.FileTypeEnum, columnList: list = [], continuousQueries: list = [], discreteQueries: list = [], transpose=False)¶

Wrapper function for query that exectues queries then exports them to the given file type, such as JSON or CSV :type parquetFilePath: string :param parquetFilePath: filepath to a parquet file to be queried on

Parameters:
  • outFilePath (string) – name of the file that query results will written to
  • outFileType (FileTypeEnum) – an enumerated object specifying what sort of file to which results will be exported
  • columnList (list of strings) – list of column names that will be included in the data resulting from the queries
  • continuousQueries (list of ContinuousQuery objects) – list of objects representing queries on a column of continuous data
  • discreteQueries (list of DiscreteQuery objects) – list of objects representing queries on a column of discrete data
  • transpose (Boolean) – if True, index and columns will be transposed
UseParquet.getColumnInfo(parquetFilePath, columnName: str, sizeLimit: int = None) → ColumnInfo.ColumnInfo¶

Given a parquet file and column name, returns a ColumnInfo object describing the column’s name,data type (discrete/continuous), and all its unique values

Parameters:
  • parquetFilePath (string) – filepath to a parquet file to be examined
  • columnName (string) – the name of the column about which information is being obtained
  • sizeLimit (int) – limits the number of unique values returned to be no more than this number
UseParquet.getColumnNames(parquetFilePath) → list¶

Returns a list of all column names from a given parquet dataset :type parquetFilePath: string :param parquetFilePath: filepath to a parquet file to be examined

UseParquet.peek(parquetFilePath, numRows=10, numCols=10) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Takes a look at the first few rows and columns of a parquet file and returns a pandas dataframe corresponding to the number of requested rows and columns

Parameters:
  • parquetFilePath (string) – filepath to a parquet file to be examined
  • numRows (int) – the number of rows the returned Pandas dataframe will contain
  • numCols (int) – the number of columns the returned Pandas dataframe will contain
Returns:

int – dataframe representing the information peeked at from the parquet file
UseParquet.peekByColumnNames(parquetFilePath, listOfColumnNames, numRows=10) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Returns a pandas dataframe containing row data for a given list of column names

Parameters:
  • parquetFilePath (string) – filepath to a parquet file to be examined
  • numRows (int) – the number of rows the returned Pandas dataframe will contain
UseParquet.query(parquetFilePath, columnList: list = [], continuousQueries: list = [], discreteQueries: list = []) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Performs mulitple queries on a parquet dataset. If no queries or columns are passed, it returns the entire dataset as a pandas dataframe. Otherwise, returns only the queried data over the requested columns as a Pandas dataframe

Parameters:
  • parquetFilePath (string) – filepath to a parquet file to be queried on
  • columnList (list of strings) – list of column names that will be included in the data resulting from the queries
  • continuousQueries (list of ContinuousQuery objects) – list of objects representing queries on a column of continuous data
  • discreteQueries (list of DiscreteQuery objects) – list of objects representing queries on a column of discrete data
